description: Borrowed from French cheville. Doublet of clavicle.

entries.meaning: (poetry) A word or phrase whose only function is to make a sentence metrically balanced.
examples: The genius of prose rejects the cheville no less emphatically than the laws of verse; and the cheville, I should perhaps explain to some of my readers, is any meaningless or very watered phrase employed to strike a balance in the sound.
